body:
@fuorissimo 
I looked at the last screenshot and hadn't seen that you chose 2 GPUs. If you you will choose 2 GPUs at the bottom of table you will see 2 devices (two device indexes). Try to type 0,1 (two device indexes separated by comma) when the script requires it

> 
> 
> @fuorissimo
> I looked at the last screenshot and hadn't seen that you chose 2 GPUs. If you you will choose 2 GPUs at the bottom of table you will see 2 devices (two device indexes). Try to type 0,1 (two device indexes separated by comma) when the script requires it

Read better and look at the 3 screenshots. They prove what I say: multiGPU has some bugs.

issue.title: Multi-graphics training is very slow

repository.name: DeepFaceLab
repository.description: DeepFaceLab is the leading software for creating deepfakes.

issue.body:
Examples:
1 graphics card,
DF, 128 res, bs8, each iter takes 300 ms,

3 graphics cards, DF, 128 res, bs8, each iter takes 1400 ms,

If you use more graphics cards, DF, 128 res, bs8, each iter will take more time.

Can you optimize multi-graphics training？

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46339824/79037073-acd97c80-7c00-11ea-9ab6-966f0e62e4fc.jpg)

![3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46339824/79037080-b236c700-7c00-11ea-86fa-be541a92c4d6.jpg)

body:
1 GPU : 10 bs
2 GPU : 10 bs = 5 bs per gpu.

Set 20 bs when using 2 GPU, and compare time per 1 batch.

Also the speed of DFL is decreased after upgrading to tf 2.x to support RTX 3x
also you can use second GPU to train second fake simultaneously

> 
> 
> 1 GPU : 10 bs
> 2 GPU : 10 bs = 5 bs per gpu.
> 
> Set 20 bs when using 2 GPU, and compare time per 1 batch.
> 
> Also the speed of DFL is decreased after upgrading to tf 2.x to support RTX 3x

That's what I've already done and explained in this post, attaching the screenshots. In reality the GPU function has no use, it raises the number of batches but also doubles the iteration time. Can't this problem be solved? Those with 2 GPUs have no benefit. Maybe adding SLI support? Its important allow REAL multiGPU use

nope.
You set 10 bs for 2 GPU.
Set 20 bs and post screenshot.

> Those with 2 GPUs have no benefit. 

you can use second GPU to train second fake simultaneously

and where did you read that multigpu is for speed increase?
it is for batch size increase.
More batch size - better model accuracy, better quality.

> 
> 
> and where did you read that multigpu is for speed increase?
> it is for batch size increase.
> More batch size - better model accuracy, better quality.

Having double BS and double iteration time doesn't make much sense and is useless. The quality depends on the total number of iterations, the BS just makes things faster. But if the time is longer, I don't understand what it is for.

Here are the screenshots you ask me

https://ibb.co/X2Sv6xR
https://ibb.co/Vtvn4zY

1 X GPU batch 10 = 1200ms and GPU load 90%

2 X GPU batch 20 = 2400ms and GPU load 40/50%.

The problem is that DFL in multigpu does not use the GPU at 90% and therefore wastes resources.

This is an example. https://ibb.co/rQmWwXG

Before you tell me it is a bottleneck of my PC, it is not because 2 different projects, as you have seen, work perfectly (1200ms for each at bs 10)

using multigpu should not be faster. 
It can be faster on small models.

>  The quality depends on the total number of iterations, the BS just makes things faster.

no. Quality also depends on batch size.
also GPU waits while CPU prepare samples for the training.

Here 2 project at the same time, BS10 each 1200ms and both GPU near to 100% load (task manager show wrong data). That is BS20 at 1200, so double. My system work correctly. 

As indicate before, multiGPU don't use full GPU load but only 20/50% and so, time is double


https://ibb.co/cx1ChYk
